intro: Oxystelma gilliesii, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Oxystelma gilliesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
